intro: Cuellaria obovata, commonly known as the broad-ovate cuellaria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. Cuellaria obovata is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, where it thrives in full sun and well-drained soil.
